items.content_html:
üèõ MinSU Core Values (R.I.C.E.)

Resilience

We strive hard to regain the University‚Äôs strength quickly amidst adversities for sustained growth and empowerment.

Integrity

We adhere to the value of respect and champion the practice of an upright moral code crucial in reaching the University‚Äôs vision and mission.

Commitment

We internalize the value of dedication to hard work to meet quality standards and share this value as zeal towards achieving excellent performance.

Excellence

We uphold outstanding performance in the University‚Äôs quadruple functions ‚Äî instruction, research, extension, and production.

items.title: Minsu Page
items.summary: üìñ Early Beginnings MinSU began as the Mindoro National Agricultural School (MINAS), established by Republic Act No. 506, sponsored by Congressman Raul T. Leuterio. It formally opened on August 26, 1951, with just 26 students. Through R.A. 10596 (2013), MINSCAT became Mindoro State University (MinSU).
items.content_html:
üìñ Early Beginnings

MinSU began as the Mindoro National Agricultural School (MINAS), established by Republic Act No. 506, sponsored by Congressman Raul T. Leuterio.

It formally opened on August 26, 1951, with just 26 students.

üå± Growth & Changes

  • 1963: By virtue of R.A. 3758, MINAS opened its Collegiate Department offering college-level courses ‚Äì the first being two years toward a Bachelor of Science in Agriculture (BSA).
  • 1973‚Äì1977: Added AAT (1973), BSAE (1975), and full BSA (1977).
  • 1976: Elevated into Mindoro College of Agriculture and Technology (MCAT).

üè´ Becoming a State College & Integrations

  • 1994‚Äì1995: Converted into Mindoro State College of Agriculture and Technology (MinSCAT) under R.A. 8007.
  • 2001: Integration of Bongabong College of Fisheries and Calapan School of Arts and Trades.

üéì Conversion into University

Through R.A. 10596 (2013), MINSCAT became Mindoro State University (MinSU). It offers higher education, research, and extension programs relevant to socio-economic development.

R.A. 11006 (2018) later clarified CHED compliance requirements for university recognition.

üë®‚Äçüè´ Leadership & Recognition

  • Eligio C. Ureta (1951‚Äì1962)
  • Onofre F. Martin (1962‚Äì1963)
  • Dr. Angelito A. Bacudo (1996‚Äì2007)
  • Dr. Jesse T. Zamora (2007‚Äì2018)
  • Dr. Levy B. Arago, Jr. (2021‚Äì2025)

üåç Current Status & Vision

MinSU is the first state university in Oriental Mindoro, with three campuses: Main (Victoria), Bongabong, and Calapan City. It serves about 10,531 students and 302 staff.

The university aims to be a center of excellence in agriculture, fisheries, environment, technology, education, business, arts & sciences, research, and extension services.

Happy Teachers' Day

Today, we celebrate our amazing mentors who go beyond teaching ‚Äî those who inspire curiosity, nurture innovation, and guide us toward a future built on knowledge and purpose.

Thank you, CCS faculty, for your dedication, wisdom, and endless patience. You are the true code behind our success!

Greetings from the College of Computer Studies!
